info.title: OSM features API
info.description: The OSM Features API provides a comprehensive suite of endpoints for accessing OpenStreetMap (OSM) features in GeoJSON format, designed to streamline the integration and utilization of OSM data in applications. By leveraging daily syncs from the OSM database through osm2pgsql imports, the API ensures the delivery of up-to-date and efficiently processed data. Endpoints include retrieving lists and specific details of Places, Administrative Areas, Hiking Routes, and Poles, each identifiable by unique osmfeatures IDs and accompanied by their latest update timestamps. The API allows for fetching single items or lists, providing data in GeoJSON format. Every endpoint is provided with detailed descriptions, parameters and responses.

get.description: Returns a list of Admin Areas with their details. Optionally, filtered by updated_at, bbox, admin_level and score. Paginated results are available.

updated_at.description: When the admin area was last updated in OSM, in ISO 8601 format.

get.summary: Get Admin Area by Osmfeatures ID
get.description: Returns a single Admin Area in GeoJSON format

osm_type.description: Type of the OSM object (N, W, R)

updated_at.description: When the area was last updated in OSM, in ISO 8601 format.

osm_url.description: URL to the Openstreetmap corresponding feature.

osm_api.description: URL to the OSM API for the object

wikimedia_commons.description: Wikimedia Commons link for the area

geometry.description: Geometry of the area in GeoJSON format

post.summary: Calculate and return Admin Areas that intersect the provided GeoJSON
post.description: Given a GeoJSON object containing the 'geometry' property and, optionally, the filters updated_at, admin_level and score, the API returns a GeoJSON FeatureCollection containing all Admin Areas whose geometries intersect the provided one. The response payload includes all properties of the admin_area model.

updated_at.description: Admin Area updated after this date

get.description: Returns a list of Hiking Routes with their details. Optionally filtered by updated_at, bbox, score, etc. Paginated results are available.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Hiking Routes that have osm2cai status greater than or equal to the specified value. Max status is 3.

get.summary: Get Hiking Routes by Osmfeatures ID
get.description: Returns a single Hiking Route in GeoJSON format

200.description: Return the Geojson Feature of the Hiking Route

get.description: Returns a list of Places with their IDs and updated timestamps. Optionally filtered by updated_at, bbox and score. Paginated results are available.
Returns a single Place in GeoJSON format

Returns a list of Poles with their IDs and updated timestamps. Optionally provide an 'updated_at' and bbox parameter to filter poles. Paginated results are available, with each page containing 100 poles. Use the 'page' parameter to specify the page number to retrieve.
Returns a single Pole in GeoJSON format

osm_type.description: Type of the OSM object (N, W, R)

updated_at.description: When the pole was last updated in OSM, in ISO 8601 format.

ele.description: Elevation of the pole in meters

osm_url.description: URL to the Openstreetmap corresponding feature.

osm_api.description: URL to the OSM API for the object

wikimedia_commons.description: Wikimedia Commons link for the pole

geometry.description: Geometry of the pole in GeoJSON format

id.description: The Osmfeatures ID of the object

from.description: The starting index of items on current page

path.description: Base path of the API endpoint

to.description: The ending index of items on current page

total.description: Total number of items across all pages

list_updated_at.name: updated_at
list_updated_at.description: Returns elements updated after this date (ISO 8601 format).

list_bbox.name: bbox
list_bbox.description: Bounding box to filter elements; format [minLon, minLat, maxLon, maxLat].

list_score.name: score
list_score.description: Filter elements that have a score greater than or equal to the specified value.
